Obradović: Rešenje za trenutnu situaciju je pomeranje izbora i formiranje prelazne tehničke vlade

07 Nov 2019, 20:15

Lider Dveri Boško Obradović kazao je danas da je rešenje za trenutnu "političku krizu" u Srbiji pomeranje izbora, odnosno potpisivanje sporazuma izmedju vlasti i opozicije i donošenje lex specijalisa, kao i formiranje prelazne tehničke vlade u kojoj bi bili i predstavnici vlasti i opozicije do izbora."Ako je ovo moglo u Crnoj Gori i Makedoniji, a što ovo ne može u Srbiji", rekao je Obradović za televiziju N1.Dodao je da Brisel i Vašington ne treba da Srbiji "pričaju o demokratiji ako podržavaju režim Aleksandra Vučića".On je rekao da je u ovom trenutku "jedina normalna stvar da se bojkotuju predstojeći izbori na proleće, bojkotuje Skupština i uskrati legitimitet".Govoreći o nedavnom protestu ispred zgrade Radio-televizije Srbije (RTS) tokom gostovanja predsednika Srbije Aleksandra Vučića u emisiji "Upitnik" kazao da su slike sa tog protesta "slike suspendovane države"."Gde to u svetu predsednik ne ulazi na glavni ulaz u državnu televiziju", upitao je Obradović i dodao da je Vučić "ušao na tajna vrata".On je rekao da su ispred zgrade RTS-a bili "čudni ljudi za koje se nije znalo da li su policajci u civilu ili kriminalci, kao i da su oni blokirali Abredarevu ulicu"."Kada budemo došli na vlast, RTS će morati da radi svoj posao po zakonu", poručio je Obradović.Dodao je da opozicija traži pravo na objektivno informisanje i da su oni zaštitnici Ustava i zakona."Ja tamo idem da odbranim Ustav i zakon", rekao je Obradović.On je naveo da on predstavlja ljude koji su "ugroženi pod ovim režimom".

Obradovic: The solution to the current situation is to move elections and form a transitional technical government

07 Nov 2019, 19:15

Dveri leader Bosko Obradovic said today that the solution to the current "political crisis" in Serbia is to move elections, that is, to sign an agreement between the government and the opposition and to bring in lex specialties, as well as to form a transitional technical government that would include representatives of the government and opposition before the elections "If this could happen in Montenegro and Macedonia, and what this cannot in Serbia," Obradovic told N1 television. He added that Brussels and Washington should not "talk to Serbia about democracy if they support the Alexander Vucic regime." said at the moment "the only normal thing to do is boycott the upcoming spring elections, boycott the Assembly and deny legitimacy." Talking about the recent protest in front of the Serbian Radio and Television (RTS) building during the appearance of Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic on "Questionnaire" said that the images from that protest were "images of a suspended state." He added that there were "strange people in front of the RTS building who were not known whether the police were civilians or criminals, and that they blocked Abredar Street." When we come to power, the RTS will have to do its job under the law, "Obradovic said. He added that the opposition was seeking the right to objective information and that they were the defenders of the Constitution and the law." I go there to defend the Constitution and the law. Obradovic said. He stated that he represented people who were "endangered under this regime."
